clip_caption:
üç≥ Oyakodon. Whether you‚Äôre sick or just sick of it all, you still need to eat well. Make oyakodon: a comforting combo of simmered chicken, sweet onions, fluffy eggs, and hot rice.

Tip: Divide your eggs and cook them in layers. Whites first, yolks last. This way, you get more control over how runny or molten you want your yolks to be.

* 1 cup boneless, skinless chicken thighs
* ¬Ω tbsp sake
* ¬º cup dashi
* 1 tbsp soy sauce
* 1 tbsp mirin
* 1 tsp white sugar
* 1 white onion, sliced into half moons
* 2‚Äì3 large eggs, separated to whites and yolks
* minced green onions
* shichimi togarashi, to taste
* sansho pepper, to taste

Full step-by-step recipe on pepper.ph, link in bio.
clip_transcription: I have a flu right now, so I have no will to cook, but I still need something healthy and comforting. So here's something quick for the sick. This oyakodon just calls for a five-minute marination. So mix up some dashi, soy, mirin, and a bit of sugar, then dump that all into a pan. Gently cook down the onions and chicken, and for the grand finale, a not-so-secret tip, separate the egg whites from the yolks, so in the end, you're left with a gorgeous, jammy yolk. Finish it off with green onions, sancho, and togarashi, and there you have it, oyakodon for one. Stay safe, guys.
recipe: 1. mix dashi, soy sauce, mirin, and sugar in a bowl and marinate chicken for five minutes. 2. pour the mixture into a pan. 3. gently cook the onion slices and chicken in the mixture. 4. separate egg whites from yolks. 5. add egg whites to the pan, cook until set. 6. just before serving, add the yolks to achieve a jammy texture. 7. garnish with green onions, sancho, and togarashi. serve over hot rice.
things_to_know: whether you‚Äôre sick or just sick of it all, you still need to eat well. make oyakodon: a comforting combo of simmered chicken, sweet onions, fluffy eggs, and hot rice. tip: divide your eggs and cook them in layers. whites first, yolks last. this way, you get more control over how runny or molten you want your yolks to be.
ingredients: 1 cup boneless, skinless chicken thighs, ¬Ω tbsp sake, ¬º cup dashi, 1 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp mirin, 1 tsp white sugar, 1 white onion, sliced into half moons, 2‚Äì3 large eggs, separated to whites and yolks, minced green onions, shichimi togarashi, sansho pepper

clip_caption:
These Hot Honey Cured Egg Yolks were 1 of 2 experiments I did with some egg yolks recently and I am pleased to say they worked out spectacularly.

These yolks firm up gently and become this spreadable consistency. Aside from just eating them, I've not quite figured out how else to use them.

You can do this with regular honey, but when there's a jar of Hot Honey in the fridge, what else are you gonna use? 

Let me know if you try these Hot Honey Cured Egg Yolks out! I want to know what you think! ü§ò

#eggs #yolkporn #honey #hothoney #fermentation  #foodart #foodreels #instafoodie #recipe #easyrecipes
clip_transcription: Now if you haven't had a honey-cured egg yolk before, I kind of feel bad for you. That's so good. I want that on my mum. Grab your eggs, crack them open and separate the yolks. Get some honey. I'm using my hot honey for this one. Place the yolks into a dish and pour over enough honey to completely cover the yolks. Put on a lid and then stick them into the fridge for 3-5 days to cure. Once cured, remove from the fridge and admire these gorgeous golden pearls. The yolks have firmed up to a spreadable, almost jam-like consistency. Place the spicy yolks on some crispy bread, smash them down and why not finish with a little extra hot honey and a touch of sea salt for good measure. These look gorgeous and taste amazing, so what are you waiting for? Give this one a go, it's well worth it. Crack that egg, jam your yolk and don't forget to like and follow.
recipe: 1. grab your eggs, crack them open and separate the yolks. 2. get some hot honey and place the yolks into a dish. 3. pour over enough honey to completely cover the yolks. 4. put on a lid and then stick them into the fridge for 3-5 days to cure. 5. once cured, remove from the fridge and admire the yolks. 6. place the yolks on some crispy bread, smash them down. 7. finish with a little extra hot honey and a touch of sea salt.
ingredients: egg yolks, hot honey, sea salt, crispy bread

clip_caption:
I will probably be eating this everyday until I get sick of it. With the help of frozen Costco sea bass, I‚Äôve unlocked a perfect meal that scores HIGH on price, convenience, and flavor. It costs less than $2.50 per serving, can be prepared from frozen, and you don‚Äôt need to visit a fish monger. It‚Äôs a version of the popular Chinese steamed sea bass that we all loved as a kid (except me), and it can be made in 20 minutes flat. 15 minutes if you already have the ginger and scallion prepared.

I was honestly surprised to learn that most of us loved this dish as a kid, because I absolutely HATED it. There was a period of time my mom made this for dinner almost every night and choking on fish bones was my worst nightmare üòÖ¬†But as an adult, I‚Äôve finally grown to love this dish because of how simple, light, yet incredibly delicious it is - it‚Äôs one of my favorite things to order at a Chinese restaurant.

Ingredients:

- Costco frozen sea bass filet
- 2 inch ginger (julienned)
- 1 - 2 green onions (julienned)
- 2 tbsp vegetable oil (or another neutral oil)
- 1.5 tbsp soy sauce

Instructions

- Julienne the ginger and green onions. Make sure to separate the green and white parts
- Place the frozen filet in a steamer
- Place ginger and green onion whites on top of fish
- Steam for 12 minutes over simmering water (medium high heat)
- Heat up vegetable oil to 350F degrees (or when the oil begins shimmering / shows slight wisp of smoke)
- Place the remaining scallion greens on top of the steamed fish
- Drizzle hot oil onto fish
- Add soy sauce on top

Enjoy!

#seabass #fishrecipes #cantonesefood #chinesefood #asianfood #asianamerican #costcofinds #costcodeals #costcohaul #seafoodlover #steamedfish #dinnerideas #easyrecipes #dougdoesdelicious
clip_transcription: I've got the perfect, easy, and delicious 20-minute lunch for you. Costco sells frozen sea bass, which works great for making this popular Chinese steamed fish in 20 minutes flat. I count it. It's cheap, it's delicious, and it's convenient because you can steam it straight from frozen. And the best part is you won't choke on a fish bone because there are none. For my fellow Chinese Americans, you either loved this dish or hated it as a kid. Seems like most of us loved it, which I didn't anticipate. But I hated it because if you weren't careful, you got stabbed in the throat with a prickly fish bone. And we've all been there, careful or not. But my mom kept saying eating fish will make you smarter. But I refused because who cares about having 200 IQ if I die choking on a fish? But now I'm older, and you know what? I've genuinely grown to appreciate this dish, and it is now one of my favorites. So thank you, mom, for never giving up on me.
recipe: 1. julienne the ginger and green onions, separating the green and white parts. 2. place the frozen filet in a steamer. 3. place ginger and green onion whites on top of the fish. 4. steam for 12 minutes over simmering water (medium-high heat). 5. heat up vegetable oil to 350¬∞f (or until the oil shimmers or shows slight wisp of smoke). 6. place the remaining scallion greens on top of the steamed fish. 7. drizzle hot oil onto the fish. 8. add soy sauce on top.
things_to_know: can be made using frozen sea bass from costco. convenient as it requires no fish monger and costs less than $2.50 per serving. the dish is bone-free, making it safer to eat.
ingredients: costco frozen sea bass filet, 2 inch ginger (julienned), 1-2 green onions (julienned), 2 tbsp vegetable oil (or another neutral oil), 1.5 tbsp soy sauce

Chilli crisp potato button noodle ‚ú®‚úÖ

Here‚Äôs what you need:
300gr peeled potatoes, boil till soft

Water as needed for kneading 

Seasoning:

#homecooking #potatonoodles #noodle #veganrecipeshare #potatorecipes #easycooking #asmrfood

recipe: 1. boil 300g peeled potatoes until soft. 2. mash the potatoes and add 80g potato flour and 50g tapioca flour. 3. add water as needed and knead into a dough. 4. shape the dough into small button-shaped pieces. 5. in a pan, heat 2 tbsp of hot cooking oil. 6. add 1 tbsp dried chilli flakes and 1 tbsp minced garlic. 7. stir in 1 tbsp soy sauce and 1 chopped scallion. 8. toss the potato button noodles in the seasoning mixture. 9. serve hot.
ingredients: potatoes, potato flour, tapioca flour, hot cooking oil, dried chilli flakes, minced garlic, soy sauce, scallion, water

clip_caption:
Scissor-cut noodles‰∏®Ââ™ÂàÄÈù¢

Scissor-cut noodles, specialty from Shanxi (Â±±Ë•ø) are extremely easy to make. To diverge from the usual tomato and egg or hot oil sauces, I tried a brown butter sauce for a nuttier and sweeter flavor (Thanks @devan.grimsrud for the brown butter influence!).

I wrote about the history of noodles in China, full story, recipe in my newsletter! 

Ingredients

* 200g all-purpose flour
* 90g water (room temperature)
* 2 g salt
For the Sauce
* 1 tbsp vegetable oil
* 2 tbsp unsalted butter
* 2 cloves of garlic
* 2 scallions
* 2 tsp chili flakes
* 1 tsp Chinkiang vinegar
* 2 tsp sweet soy sauce or regular soy sauce
* 50g bean sprouts (optional)

#noodles #handmadenoodles #chinesefood #chineserecipe

YOUR FULL SNOWDON VIA CRIB GOCH GUIDE ‚õ∞Ô∏èü§ù

This definitely isn‚Äôt a beginner hike. It includes a good bit of scrambling and it‚Äôs over 11 km in distance. Expect this to take in excess of four hours! 

that being said in my opinion, it‚Äôs definitely in, the top three hikes in the UK, parking can be a little bit of a nightmare in the busier months but there are various park-and-ride options available! 

Yeh I know it‚Äôs called Yr Wyddfa but leave me along my English is bad enough üò≠

HIKE! ü•æüßó‚õ∞Ô∏è

#hikingadventures #snowdonia #hikeuk #northwales #hikinglife #camping #wildcamping
clip_transcription: So this is me on arguably one of the sketchiest hikes in the UK, Snowdon via Gribgoch. So the start of the walk is pretty flat until you hit Gribgoch, and when you do, you'll know straight away as you'll encounter this steep section. I recommend going as low and slow as possible. Carry on until you hit the ridge. Now the ridge is absolutely breathtaking. It's about twice as long as Striding Edge and it's so dramatic. But you do need to do a little bit of rock climbing to get through this section. You'll carry on and you'll hit a second ridge, which again is just as dramatic as the first, and then you hit the summit. Once you've finished taking in the stunning North Wale views, you're going to want to head down. Now I recommend heading down via the Miner's Path or the Pig Path. It's a little bit safer and a little bit quicker. And as you can see, you can take in some stunning views of the tarns in the area. And I also recommend finishing the night off with a camp if you can. Some of my favourite camping locations are located in Anglesey and North Wales. And as always, thanks for watching and I'll see you in the next one.
things_to_know: this hike is not for beginners, includes scrambling, and is over 11 km long. it can take over four hours. parking can be difficult during busier months, but park-and-ride options are available.
tags: hikingadventures, snowdonia, hikeuk, northwales, hikinglife, camping, wildcamping
title: snowdon via crib goch guide

clip_caption:
Cooking doesn‚Äôt need to be hard or complicated. Often, you‚Äôre simply looking for a recipe that gets you most of the way there with minimal effort, hence 80/20.

Here is the simplest Hainanese chicken and rice recipe you can make all in your rice cooker that delivers most of the results without needing to boil and poach a whole chicken.

Don‚Äôt forget to make the sauces!

Check out full recipes at dougdoesdelicious.com üë®‚Äçüç≥

**Ingredients:**
**Chicken**
- 1 lb chicken thighs bone-in (450g)
- 2 tsp sesame oil (5g)
- 1/4 tsp salt (1 - 1.5g)

**Rice**
- 2 cups jasmine rice
- 6 garlic cloves, minced or grated (10g)
- 1/2 inch ginger, minced or grated (10g)
- 2 scallions, chopped (20g)
- ~2 cups chicken broth (fill your rice cooker with slightly less than you would normally use for 2 cups of rice)
- 1 tsp chicken bouillon (5g)
- optional: 1/2 tsp turmeric powder (2.5 - 5g)

**Ginger Scallion Sauce**
- 1/2 inch ginger, minced or grated (10g)
- 1 green onions, minced (10g)
- 1 tsp sesame oil (3g)
- Salt to taste (0.5g)
- 3 tbsp neutral oil (30g)

**Chili sauce**
- 6 garlic cloves, minced (10g)
- 1/2 inch ginger, minced (10g)
- 2 tbsp sambal (25g)
- 2 tbsp sriracha (25g)
- 2 tbsp chicken stock (20g)
- 1 tbsp lime juice (5g)
- 2 teaspoons sugar (9g)

Optional: a couple slices of cucumbers adds a nice freshness to the dish!

#pareto #8020rule #hainanesechicken #chickenrice #gingerscallion #chinesefood #asianfood #asianamerican #dinnerideas #easyrecipes #dougdoesdelicious
clip_transcription: Welcome to 80-20 Recipes, where I show you how to get 80% of the results with 20% of the effort. Here is the simplest Hainanese chicken recipe you can make that doesn't require you to boil and poach a whole chicken. And you can make all of this in your rice cooker. For the chicken, we're using chicken thighs with skin on. I used to make this the 100% way. In fact, Hainanese chicken was one of the first real recipes I attempted when I started learning how to cook back in college. Each week, my roommates and I would pick a new dish that we'd try to master. And one week, it was Hainanese chicken. So what we would do is, we'd buy all of its ingredients in bulk, and make that dish non-stop for an entire week until we felt like we nailed it, or ran out of ingredients. There were weeks where we had Hainanese chicken for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. So yeah, while the 100% way is delicious, I wish we knew about this 80-20 version back in university, because it's so much easier, and I think it gets you more than close enough. Especially if you make the iconic ginger scallion and chili sauce to go with it. Which, in my opinion, is what really completes this dish.
recipe: 1. marinate 1 lb chicken thighs with 2 tsp sesame oil and 1/4 tsp salt. 2. rinse and drain 2 cups jasmine rice. 3. place rice in the rice cooker. 4. add 6 minced garlic cloves, 1/2 inch minced ginger, and 2 chopped scallions to the rice. 5. pour in ~2 cups chicken broth and 1 tsp chicken bouillon (optional: 1/2 tsp turmeric powder). 6. place the marinated chicken thighs on top of the rice. 7. cook everything together in the rice cooker. 8. for ginger scallion sauce, mix 1/2 inch minced ginger, 1 minced green onion, 1 tsp sesame oil, a pinch of salt, and 3 tbsp neutral oil. 9. for chili sauce, mix 6 minced garlic cloves, 1/2 inch minced ginger, 2 tbsp sambal, 2 tbsp sriracha, 2 tbsp chicken stock, 1 tbsp lime juice, and 2 tsp sugar. 10. serve the chicken and rice with the sauces.
ingredients: chicken thighs, sesame oil, salt, jasmine rice, garlic, ginger, scallions, chicken broth, chicken bouillon, turmeric powder, green onions, neutral oil, sambal, sriracha, lime juice, sugar

Links to all our Iceland activities & experiences are saved in the ‚ÄúIceland‚Äù highlight.

#iceland #ringroad #travelguide #icelandtravel #vanlifetravel #icelandvanlife #getyourguidecommunity #getyourguidepartner
clip_transcription: We drove Iceland's entire ring road in 7 days and here's how to do it. On day 0, you're going to arrive at the airport, pick up your rental car, and hit the Blue Lagoon. Trust me, relaxing here is the perfect way to end a travel day. The next morning, you'll start your first official day at Sellylandsfoss. Be sure to check out the secret canyon waterfall right next door. And then it's off to Sk√≥gafoss where you also want to hike back into the highlands for even more waterfalls. You'll start day 2 with a drive down to the Black Sand Beach and check out the nearby sea cliffs and lighthouse before continuing your drive onto the canyon that no one can pronounce. Day 3 starts off with one of the most unique experiences we've ever done, hiking on a glacier in Vatnaj√∂kull National Park. After the hike, you'll end the day at Diamond Beach and the Glacier Lagoon. Day 4 kicks off with a scenic drive along the eastern coast of the island and be sure to keep your eye out for reindeer here. Then relax and shower at Vokbas before ending the day at Sulegill Canyon. On day 5, you'll take a walk around the Mifton Geothermal Area and check out G√∂tafoss on your way to Akureyri to grab some food. Day 6 is all about exploring the Snaefellnes Peninsula with stops at Kirksj√∂fell and the Arnostapi coastal cliffs. The final day starts off at Reykjavik's Sky Lagoon and ends by exploring and walking the streets of the city.

clip_caption:
BUILD YOUR OWN STEAMING NOODLE HOT POT

@soupcomcr has recently opened its doors just off Piccadilly Gardens, serving up huge noodle hot pots that you create yourself, just like a pick n‚Äô mix.

The concept is dead simple. Grab a bowl, fill it with as many ingredients as you like, and then choose your broth to go with it.

There are loads of options, ranging from the expected to the unexpected ‚Äì so there are prawns, pak choi, quail eggs, Japanese sausage and meatballs, right up to jellyfish, duck blood, crab nuggets, purple sweet potato noodles, and even frogs legs (and that‚Äôs barely scratching the surface).

Then you pick your broth, so you‚Äôve got the signature spicy malatang, tom yum, mushroom, and a peanut dry mix.

It‚Äôs ¬£2.99 for every 100g of ingredients, and the broth is ¬£3.50, so add as much or as little as you like, then get properly stuck in.

It‚Äôs great fun, and delicious. Win win.

....

‚è∞ 11am - 10:30pm Monday - Sunday
üìçB5, City Tower, Mosley St, Manchester M1 4BT
üí∞¬£2.99 per 100g and soup bases are ¬£3.50

#mcrfinest
clip_transcription: There's a brand new hot pot noodle place, and you need to come and try it. Soup Co, let's go. The concept is, pop your ingredients in your bowl, choose your soup mix, so you've got different ones here. Yeah, let's see what we can get. There's a lot of selection. We're gonna get stuck into it. All right, let's get some meatballs. Daphne's actually gonna do it. Influence me. I got a crab nugget! There is so much to choose from. So you've got loads of veg, there's meatballs, mussels, squid, beef tendons, and they've even got frog's legs. So it's ¬£2.99 for 100 grams, and you can weigh it as you go along to see where you're at. I reckon I can get a bit more in there. So after you've chose your ingredients, you've got to choose your soup. I'm gonna go for the spicy one. This is a little condiment section. Walk along, put some sauce in there, mix it up, dip your meat in there, or you can just add it to your broth. I stacked mine pretty high, and the bowl weighed in at 450 grams, so with the ingredients and the broth, it came to ¬£16.95. So I went for the prawns, I had the pak choi, some quail eggs, Japanese sausage, meatballs, and beef, and I had the spicy broth.
address: b5, city tower, mosley st, manchester m1 4bt
recipe: 1. grab a bowl, fill it with as many ingredients as you like 2. choose your broth (options include spicy malatang, tom yum, mushroom, peanut dry mix) 3. weigh your bowl to determine the cost 4. add sauces from the condiment section if desired 5. enjoy your hot pot
activity_name: build your own steaming noodle hot pot
things_to_know: it‚Äôs ¬£2.99 for every 100g of ingredients, and the broth is ¬£3.50. loads of options including prawns, pak choi, quail eggs, japanese sausage, meatballs, jellyfish, duck blood, crab nuggets, purple sweet potato noodles, and frogs legs.
ingredients: prawns, pak choi, quail eggs, japanese sausage, meatballs, beef, jellyfish, duck blood, crab nuggets, purple sweet potato noodles, frogs legs

clip_caption:
A car camping tour anyone can replicate üëáüèºAD

We have been car camping for years now out of the back of multiple SUVs, and it‚Äôs always going to be one of our favorite ways to travel. It‚Äôs budget friendly, simple, and can be really comfortable with a good setup!

Here are some things that have really improved our experience: 

‚Ä¢ @segwaypowerstationofficial Cube Series Power Station: this power station has been so nice to have on our trips to charge all of our electronics, power lights, and fan, our air pump, and it can even power our outdoor camping grill. 

We charge it while we‚Äôre driving (it charges fully in 1.6 hours), it‚Äôs waterproof, durable, and we can add or remove battery packs depending on how long our trip is! The battery can function as normal from 14 degrees to 113 degrees, so we don‚Äôt have to worry about extreme temperatures affecting output. 

You can get $200 off using the code CUBE2000 at the link in our bio!

‚Ä¢ car air mattress: we used our backpacking sleeping pads for years, which is fine, but having an actual mattress that fits the car perfectly really takes advantage of all of the room available

‚Ä¢ cushions for under the heads: you lose a lot of space up past the front of the seats, so these allow us a few more inches without our heads hanging lower than the rest of us

‚Ä¢ bug nets and a tiny fan: these really help to keep it cool inside on summer trips without letting bugs in 

Do you camp in the back of your car? What‚Äôs your favorite thing about your setup?

#SegwayCube #SegwayPowerStation #Segway #PowerBeyondLimits 

#camping #carcamping #campinglife #campinggear #campgear
clip_transcription: You do not need to build out the back of your car to camp in it. We have camped in the back of our SUV for years, and this is what our setup looks like for two people. When we get to camp, the cooler and camp kitchen comes out and any soft hair gets put in the passenger seat. And the whole bed literally just unrolls and inflates. You will not catch me using a sleeping bag if it's any warmer than 50 degrees. We have piles of blankets and pillows instead. And these cushions under the heads give us a few extra inches of space to sleep so we don't feel cramped. We keep the Segway Portable Power Station Cube 2000 behind the driver's seat, and this gives us plenty of power to use our air pump, charge phones and laptops, run lights and honestly never worry about running out. We typically charge it while we're driving. And what I think is really cool is that we can add or remove battery packs depending on how long our trip is and how much power we need. We put bug nets over the window so we can roll them down and get some fresh air inside. And you would not believe how much this little tiny fan does for two people. One day we may choose to build something. But for now, we are very happy with how budget friendly and easy this setup is.
things_to_know: you do not need to build out the back of your car to camp in it. we have camped in the back of our suv for years, and this is what our setup looks like for two people. when we get to camp, the cooler and camp kitchen comes out and any soft hair gets put in the passenger seat. and the whole bed literally just unrolls and inflates. we keep the segway portable power station cube 2000 behind the driver's seat, and this gives us plenty of power to use our air pump, charge phones and laptops, run lights and honestly never worry about running out. we typically charge it while we're driving. we put bug nets over the window so we can roll them down and get some fresh air inside. and you would not believe how much this little tiny fan does for two people.

clip_caption:
This soup will blow you away. Garlic, coriander, stale bread and a poached egg. So simple, but so good! This is based on a portuguese dish called acorda, which is traditionally made with salt cod broth. But thats hard to find here in england, so I made it with chicken stock and wow. What a recipe, I love it. Takes no time at all and uses just a few humble ingredients. Enjoy!
Cre by @juliusroberts
.
.
#soup #garlic #bread #cooking #egg #fyp #recipe #easyrecipes #easysidedishrecipes #easysidedishes
clip_transcription: My brother's just been to Portugal and he came back and told me about this incredible soup. It's raining today, thought it'd be a perfect time to try it. That's insane. 10 out of 10. Very simple, just start by poaching an egg in chicken stock. Mash a couple of cloves of garlic in a pestle and mortar with a big bunch of coriander. A nice slug of olive oil. A bit of salt helps grind it to a paste. A slice of good bread. Start with the coriander paste. Stock goes in, mix it together. Slice of bread. Bit more broth on top. Olive oil. And an egg.
recipe: 1. poach an egg in chicken stock. 2. mash a couple of cloves of garlic in a pestle and mortar with a big bunch of coriander. 3. add a nice slug of olive oil and a bit of salt to grind it to a paste. 4. take a slice of good bread. 5. start with the coriander paste. 6. add stock, mix it together. 7. add a slice of bread. 8. pour a bit more broth on top. 9. drizzle with olive oil. 10. place the poached egg on top.
ingredients: egg, chicken stock, garlic, coriander, olive oil, salt, bread

clip_caption:
Not gatekeeping a favourite gem found unexpectedly. Also, its value for money and you dont have to queue. (If you go on a weekend do expect a queue)

Location here:
üìçTaniya
2 Chome-15-17 Nihonbashiningyocho, Chuo City, Tokyo 103-0013, Japan
clip_transcription: I'm not joking when I say I've fallen in love with this udon shop in Tokyo, Japan. From the way he cooks and makes the udon, I really feel the passion and love he puts into making the noodles. I mean just look at this man work, his finesse and passion is undeniable and all this translates into some of the best udon I have ever eaten. So this is the abukake special udon and before any weird comments pop up, pause to read. So I poured the dashi broth and mix everything well and oh my goodness, this was so damn good. The udon was super smooth and silky and it was springy yet firm and has such a great bite and texture to it. The meal was super hearty and I was left absolutely satisfied. So please, drop by Taniya and give their udon a try, you won't regret it.
address: 2 chome-15-17 nihonbashiningyocho, chuo city, tokyo 103-0013, japan
recipe: 1. pour the dashi broth 2. mix everything well 3. enjoy the dish
things_to_know: its value for money and you don‚Äôt have to queue. if you go on a weekend do expect a queue.

clip_transcription: Village Park mempunyai Nasi Lemak terbaik di KL. Adakah ibu anda kecewa kerana dia memberi lahir kepada perempuan asas sebegini? Semua orang sudah mengetahui Village Park, betul? Sekarang hujung minggu. Biar saya membawa anda ke tempat yang sebenarnya dimakan oleh orang Malaysia. Selamat datang ke kedai Nasi Lemak. Jadi, kami berada di kedai Nasi Lemak. Ia sebenarnya agak baru. Saya akan mengatakan sekitar setahun. Lelaki ini telah membuat Nasi Lemak selama bertahun-tahun. Dia memulakan kedai sudut ini di Bandar Utama. Di sana saya membesar. Dan sejujurnya, Nasi Lemak di sini sangat sedap. Sangat sedap. Apa yang anda mempunyai di depan anda hari ini adalah kunci kepada kerajaan. Ini adalah nasi lemak dalam cawan yang seksi. Cawan ini. Jika anda membuangnya kepada anjing, anjing akan mati. Minumlah. Ah, satu tangan telah hilang hari ini. Ia hanyalah teh. Ia lancar. Pertama barang yang kita akan makan hari ini adalah Nasi Lemak Berapa. Saya tidak tahu bagaimana orang biasanya memakannya, tetapi saya suka mencampurkan cili dan nasi terlebih dahulu. Momen kebenaran. Makanlah, kawan. Oh, sial. Anda tahu bahawa Nasi Lemak adalah sejujurnya. Pertama, apabila ia tidak berwarna biru. Biasanya tiada sosej atau kek ikan. Ini adalah ayam yang telah dipanaskan. Beri saya seorang yang menangis, kawan. Empat daripada tendangan tulang. Apa yang berlaku? Dan ia seperti, ia telah dipanaskan dengan sempurna, tetapi ia tidak terlalu keras. Dan ia sangat sempurna dengan nasi. Baiklah, jadi di sini anda mempunyai ayam kari. Kemudian mereka mempunyai beberapa sambal untuk anda. Ini adalah ikan. Dan ini adalah koko atau siham anda. Dalam Bahasa Melayu, kami menyebutnya kerang. Jadi anda suka kuk dengan nasi anda? Eh, sial. Adakah rancangan seperti ini? Jadi perkara seterusnya yang kita akan mencuba adalah dengan siham. Jenis yang berbeza, ya. Wah, ya Tuhan. Wah, ini sangat sedap. Apa yang berlaku dengan siham? Eh, kawan. Berubah hidup. Berubah hidup. Ini adalah akhir nasi lemak, saya rasa. Baiklah, jadi ini adalah dengan ayam kari sekarang. Ayam kari. Wah. Wah. Wah. Kawan. Adakah anda hanya menghidangkannya dengan ayam kari? Mereka melakukannya. Bagaimana? Jadi ada nasi lemak tanpa ayam goreng. Mereka hanya menghidangkan ayam goreng. Ah. Ia sangat sedap. Ia sangat berbau. Ia gila. Saya rasa secara perasaan, sambal ini, bagi saya, sedikit sedikit. Baiklah. Ia tidak terlalu pedas bagi saya. Jadi, satu-satunya kesalahan saya dengan nasi lemak ini adalah bahawa mereka menghidangkan ayam kari. Jika mereka mempunyai telur goreng dengan nasi lemak ini, saya rasa ia adalah 10 daripada 10. Tetapi disebabkan ayam kari, saya hanya boleh memberikan 9 daripada 10. Kawan, maaf. Sangat solid. Sebenarnya, anda betul. Mengapa saya tidak pernah membeli telur goreng? Ini salah saya. Ini salah saya. Biar saya berikan telur goreng kepada anda. Saya boleh, saya boleh menjadi penghantar pertempuran. Baiklah. Jadi, kita menambahkan telur goreng. Jadi, kita akan lihat jika ia membuat perbezaan. Ya, tempat ini sudah 10 daripada 10. Saya hanya datang ke sini. Siapa Village Park? Siapa, kawan? Siapa? Siapa? Apa? Helo?
address: g10, oasis business center bu4, changkat bandar utama, bandar utama, 47800 petaling jaya, selangor, malaysia
recipe: 1. cook the rice with coconut milk and pandan leaves. 2. prepare sambal by blending onions, garlic, dried chilies, and belacan; saut√© and simmer with tamarind juice and sugar. 3. fry the ikan bilis until crispy. 4. prepare chicken curry by saut√©ing curry paste, adding chicken and coconut milk, and simmering until cooked. 5. serve rice with sambal, chicken curry, fried ikan bilis, and boiled eggs.
things_to_know: the dish includes nasi lemak, chicken curry, sambal, ikan bilis, and siham (cockles)
ingredients: rice, coconut milk, pandan leaves, onions, garlic, dried chilies, belacan (shrimp paste), tamarind juice, sugar, ikan bilis (anchovies), chicken, curry paste, eggs

clip_caption:
HUNTING FOR LONDON‚ÄôS BEST ROAST DINNER üáÆüá≥ üçΩÔ∏è 

This week we are visiting the Tamil Prince‚Äôs sister restaurant, @the_tamil_crown for their take on the British classic. Must orders are the lamb and onion bhaji‚Äôs, both elite level dishes. Masala chicken was really good too but the lamb trumps it for me. Soft, tender, fall off the bone with the combination of all the Indian spices, ridiculously good. 

‚≠êÔ∏è If you can‚Äôt take a date, take a mate! Tag tag tag x 

#indianfood #india #london #londonfood #foodie #londonüá¨üáß #tamil #roast #roastdinner #foodporn #halal
clip_transcription: When Indian food is combined with a roast dinner, know you're in for a treat. Join me on my hunt to find the best roast in London, where this week, we're at the Temal Crown, a new desi pub in North London, sister restaurant to the Temal Prince. We're kicking things off with the onion bhajis, which are handmade to order. And to this day, they are the best onion bhaji I've ever put in my mouth. Outrageous. This is the masala lamb shank roast, which is cooked for six hours and then finished off on the grill. And they serve it with a gravy from all that leftover stock. These platters are incredible. They come with potatoes, veg, poppadoms, obviously the lamb shank, which just falls off the bone. There is such a depth in flavour. It will literally send your taste buds into next week. Prince has also brought over his famous rotis too, which he spins around his head like a lasso. The rotis here are just incredible. They're soft, they're crispy, they're buttery. Just listen to this. Just look how flaky they are. But the best part is building your roti with the lamb, with the crispy cauliflower, the cabbage, and then dunking it in that gravy. All aboard the gravy chain, choo-choo. The barbecue masala roasted chicken was another favourite too. You get these big legs of chicken, which have been marinated for days. Just look at the colour and crispiness of that skin. Gotta finish it off in a crispy poppadom. If you can't take a date, mate, enjoy.
recipe: 1. marinate lamb shank with indian spices. 2. cook for six hours. 3. finish on the grill. 4. prepare gravy from leftover stock. 5. serve with potatoes, veg, poppadoms. 6. build your roti with lamb, crispy cauliflower, cabbage, and dunk in gravy.
things_to_know: sister restaurant to the temal prince. the lamb is cooked for six hours and finished on the grill, served with a gravy made from leftover stock.
ingredients: lamb shank, indian spices, potatoes, vegetables, poppadoms, cauliflower, cabbage

clip_caption:
Ready to take on the ultimate hiking challenge? The Tour du Mont Blanc is an unforgettable 100-mile journey through three countries that will push your limits and reward you with breathtaking views. Leave your camping gear behind and embark on an adventure of a lifetime.

#tourdumontblanc #tmb #backpacking #traveltips #hiking
clip_transcription: If you're looking for your next multi-day hike, but don't want to bring any camping gear, the Tour de Mont Blanc is for you. It's a 100-mile hike that goes through Switzerland, Italy, and France and takes roughly 9-11 days to finish. It's a great stepping stone for people who want to take their day hikes to the next level. There are a lot of mountain huts or refuges along the way so you can leave your tent and sleeping bag at home. They also provide breakfast, lunch, and dinner, so no need to worry about food either. The price can range anywhere from $50 to $100 per night, including food. The only problem with refuges is that depending on the season, you might need to start booking a few months in advance to secure a spot. To book your refuges, go to www.monttourdemontblanc.com and start planning early. Please like and follow for more TMB information and general travel tips.
things_to_know: depending on the season, you might need to start booking the refuges a few months in advance to secure a spot.

clip_caption:
Share this with your hiking buddy ü•æ and make sure to follow @megmitchell123 for more hiking adventures!

Ironically this one is called Love Lake, so I made it a bit cheesier üßÄ 

üìçLove Lake, Vancouver Island, Canada

Directions

This Lake can be accessed by either taking a 45 minute boat or kayaking 22km to the trailhead. From there you hike 16km to camp and then the next day you hike up 600m to Love Lake. You want to do this for 2 nights so that you can have a lake day on the 2nd day and hike back out on the 3rd day. 

This is one of the most remote and pristine lakes in Canada and is seriously worth the hike!

This hike also brings you to Della Falls, the tallest waterfall in Canada!! üá®üá¶
clip_transcription: Promise that you'll hold me close, don't let me go Take my heart, don't break it Love me, meet me
things_to_know: this lake can be accessed by either taking a 45 minute boat or kayaking 22km to the trailhead. from there you hike 16km to camp and then the next day you hike up 600m to love lake. you want to do this for 2 nights so that you can have a lake day on the 2nd day and hike back out on the 3rd day. this hike also brings you to della falls, the tallest waterfall in canada.

clip_transcription: This rooftop playground for adults is back for summer and this is your sign to plan a visit. When it comes to fun activities in London, it does not get any better than this. This place has everything. There's an outdoor cinema, batting cages that are a lot harder than they look, mini golf from Birdies, bowls where you can drink while you play and archery where you can unlock your inner Katniss Everdeen. The food here is sensational too. A huge shout out to the chicken wings and the peppercorn sauce burger. Grab your tickets on Design My Night.

clip_caption:
üèùÔ∏èFull day of eating in Cheung Chau Island ‚¨áÔ∏è

‚õ¥Ô∏è Central to Cheung Chau
‚õ¥Ô∏è Discovery Bay > Mui Wo > Cheung Chau
‚ÄºÔ∏èEverything is in HKD$

Here are the must-try spots when you visit! There‚Äôs plenty of other seafood and snack places to try; but these happen to be around the same area and everything was simply delicious! 

üê† Hung Lok Seafood 
üìç13b Pak She Praya Road, Cheung Chau 

Their menu is pretty big but I highly recommend trying the Scallops, Fried Squid, Salt & Pepper Prawns, Deep Fried Chicken and Black Bean Clams üî• It‚Äôs best to go with at least 5-6 people so you can try more and spend less PP (the portion are also big üëÄ) 

ü•≠ Èï∑Ê¥≤Âπ≥Ë®ò (Mango Mochi)
üìç11D, Pak She Praya Road, Cheung Chau

The mango mochi and the slushy are a MUST! It‚Äôs the ultimate snack after a seafood feast. They also serve Oreo, Strawberry and Durian mochi!

üçâ ÊΩÆÈ£üÂùä (Watermelon Slice) 
üìçSan Hing St, Cheung Chau 

If you‚Äôre melting in the heat - this is the place to go (you‚Äôll thank me later) you can get different fruit slices, mango puddings and even a whole watermelon to drink from! 

üîñ Follow for more hidden gems & hot spots! 

#hongkong #hongkongfood #hkfood #explorehk #discoverhk #fyp #hkig #explorepage #viralreels #eatwithkels #hkfoodie #hkfoodlover #hongkongtrip #seafood #reelsinstagram #cheungchau #mochi #chinesefood #mango #dessert #hkfoodieblogger #hongkongblogger #hkeats #hkfoodblog #hkfoodstagram #foryou #foodiegram #foodie #hklifestyle #friedfood
clip_transcription: Here's everything I ate in Cheung Chau Island. We had the best seafood experience and it did not break the bank. Guys, this place has a fixed price based on the amount of dishes you order. So we only spent $165 each on 7 dishes, which includes drinks. That's insane. Of course, we ordered all the good stuff. Scallop, fried squid, and prawns. I love that they overloaded with garlic and you can literally eat the shell on these prawns. Oh, and this chicken definitely had some crazy MSG seasoning. Of course, we also tried the famous mango mochi and slushy. Oh my god, you have to come to Cheung Chau to eat this. We also saw this little kid eat this frozen watermelon slice. And of course, we had to track this down. And it was so worth it. Follow me for more hidden gems and hot spots.
address: 13b pak she praya road, cheung chau
dish_name: scallops, fried squid, salt & pepper prawns, deep fried chicken, black bean clams
things_to_know: fixed price based on number of dishes ordered. best to visit with 5-6 people.

clip_caption: Please please please moreee noodsü§§
clip_transcription: This is one of the best boat noodle soup in Ap Lai Chau, Hong Kong. I took a sandpan boat from Aberdeen Pier and it literally felt like I went back in time. As we got closer, you can already see there's a line. But seriously, how cool is this? After you order, he'll cut up roasted pork or chicken or duck of your choice with meatballs, spices, noodles, and soup. And you just grab it out of the boat. Ta-da! Then you find somewhere nearby to sit and eat. I think this is one of the best ways to taste Hong Kong delicacies. So yummy. Is it good? Follow me for more adventures!
activity_name: taking a sandpan boat and eating boat noodle soup
things_to_know: you may need to take a sampan boat from aberdeen pier to reach the spot.

clip_caption:

This island is home to a community of painters, potters, and sculptors, with around 26 artists‚Äô studios. Twice a year, the artists host an Open Studios event, inviting the public to explore their creative spaces.

clip_transcription: Did you know there is a secret island in London that opens to the public just twice a year for free? The island is home to a community of painters, potters and sculptors with around 26 artist studios. Twice a year, they host an open studios event, inviting the public to explore their creative spaces. It's called Earpie Island and you can visit the island on July 6th and 7th without needing to book in advance. This is such a unique place to be. Earpie Island
